result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Lukitsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs.   
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse J. Lukitsch in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Jesse J. Lukitsch in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF220, 14CF272 and 14CM39.


2:13 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF220:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI

14CF272:
Count 1 - DRI 
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - No contest
Count 4 - No contest 
Count 5 - No contest 

14CM39:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 14CF220 and Count 2 is DRI on 14CF220, Count's 2-5 guilty on 14CF272 and Count 1 is DRI on 14CF272 and Count 1 on 14CM39 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

**Neither party is requesting a PSI and will not be ordered by the Court.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14CF220:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld
36 months probation 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Provide DNA sample 
Pay DNA surcharge
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay restitution of $72.93 
Pay costs

Count 2 -
DRI

14CF272:
Count 1 - 
DRI

Count 2 - 
270 days in county jail, huber priveleges for work 
Pay costs

Count 3 -
90 days in county jail, consecutive to Count 2 - same huber priveleges
192 days jail credit (should have 78 days jail remaining)
Pay costs.

Count 4 -
Sentence withheld 
Probation for 36 months, concurrent to 14CF220
Comply with conditions in 14CF220
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Katie Kusch (contact to be determined by agent)
Pay costs

Count 5 -
Sentence withheld 
Probation for 36 months concurrent to Count 4 and 14CF220
Comply with conditions on Count 4 and 14CF220
Pay costs 


14CM39:
DRI

Defendant Jesse J. Lukitsch in court with attorney Eric P Sheets. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.

Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
